configdir.name: Config Directory: Personal Phrases Filter + Ignored Users
configdir.description:
<cy>(Hopefully.)</c>
This setting does literally nothing new except being a button that acts as a shortcut to open the config directory for this mod (which is kind of important for using this mod properly, because this is where you will store your word/phrases filter and your ignored users), because the legendary developers in the Geode Team themselves forgot to add a shortcut button that would have done this exact same thing, and I have gotten far too many folks (rightfully) asking me to find the config directory when using some of my other mods, and I hate repeating the same things over and over again, and I don't know if the next major update for Geode will also repeat this mistake where HJfod forgets to include a config directory shortcut button, so this setting and this button are here for extra insurance, so please enjoy this extra button, I guess. Anyway, by the time you're finished reading this, your device should be finished with opening the config directory; press "Aight" to close this window.

ignorePeople.name: Ignore People
ignorePeople.description:
Ignore comments from people you've "ignored", based on text files inside your config directory. A comment's contents will be replaced with an indication that you've ignored its author.

<cy>This is a purely cosmetic change.</c>

<cr>THIS DOES NOT PRODUCE THE SAME EFFECT AS BLOCKING PEOPLE THROUGH PROFILES.</c>

personalFilter.name: Personal Phrases Filter
personalFilter.description:
Hide comments containing words or phrases you dislike, based on text files inside your config directory. A comment's contents will be replaced with an indication that it contained words you dislike.

<cy>This is a purely cosmetic change, and does not apply to your own comments.</c>

hideRoleplay.name: Roleplay Filter
hideRoleplay.description:
Enable a rudimentary roleplay filter for comments.

<cy>This is a purely cosmetic change, and is not customizable via the config directory. False positives and false negatives will happen.</c>

<cr>The fact that this feature needed to exist speaks a lot about the cesspool that the daily chat has become.</c>

nameInButton.name: Show Level/List Name Instead of Level/List ID
nameInButton.description: When viewing comment histories, replace the level/list ID text with the name of that level/list if that level ID has been downloaded or if that list ID has been added to your favorites.

translateComments.name: Translate Comments
translateComments.description:
<cl>Dedicated to TastyForReal. o7</c>

Opens a menu to <cl>translate comments</c> <cy>in your web browser</c>, with three translator options: <cl>LibreTranslate</c>, <cl>DeepL</c>, and <cl>Google Translate</c>.

<cy>Translator API support will</c> <c_>NOT</c> <cy>be a part of this mod.</c>

preferredTranslator.name: Preferred Translator
preferredTranslator.description:
Choose your preferred translator <cj>when holding either SHIFT key</c> or <cj>when Deltarune Textboxes is loaded</c>:
<cl>LibreTranslate</c>, <cl>DeepL</c>, or <cl>Google Translate</c>.

sourceLanguage.name: Translation Source Language
sourceLanguage.description:
Select the language you would like to translate from.

<cy>Not all languages are supported by DeepL or LibreTranslate, so choose carefully!</c>

targetLanguage.name: Translation Target Language
targetLanguage.description:
Select the language you would like to translate into.

<cy>Not all languages are supported by DeepL or LibreTranslate, so choose carefully!</c>

blendingComments.name: Readable Mode (Stronger Blending) [READ ->]
blendingComments.description: This setting is here when there is a transparent background surrounding comment text. That's usually not true in most cases, so this is disabled by default.
